title: S5 Ep6: A French revolution in state-building

description: One of the most remarkable achievements of the French Revolution for ordinary people was the reorganisation of local government. CÃ©dric Chambru, Emeric Henry and Benjamin Marx tell Tim Phillips how local state capitals emerged as a result, and what this tells us about how state capacity develops.
